content: The Act may be cited as the "Preserving Access to Manufactured Housing Act of 2013". It defines the term "Mortgage Originator". The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform Act is amended to include regulations regarding retailers of manufactured or modular homes and their employees receiving compensation for certain activities. Technical amendments are also made to the Truth in Lending Act. The Truth in Lending Act is amended by adding a new subsection and redesignating existing subsections. The amendments made by this section will take effect as if they were included in the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform Act. SEC. 3. HIGH-COST MORTGAGE DEFINITION. Section 103 of the Truth in Lending Act is amended to redesignate subsections related to disclosure and high-cost mortgages. Changes include adjustments to clauses regarding percentage points and transaction amounts. The Truth in Lending Act is amended to include new clauses related to high-cost mortgages, specifically addressing first mortgages on a consumer's principal dwelling with an annual percentage rate exceeding the average prime offer rate for a comparable transaction.
